intro: Ainsliaea sutchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are oval to lance-shaped. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
